intro: Oedibasis chaerophylloides, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has adapted to survive in harsh environments through deep taproots and reduced leaf surface area. Oedibasis chaerophylloides is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
